sentence.Network_en: Unfortunately for Wilson, such a solid phalanx did not materialize.
sentence.Network_cn: 对威尔逊来说, 不幸的是这种团结并没有形成.

sentence.Network_en: He had ranked himself in the numerous phalanx of unbelievers.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一直象其它无数怀疑者一样持怀疑态度.

sentence.Network_en: At last , a phalanx of soldiers rescued us.
sentence.Network_cn: 一支密集队形的军队终于前来搭救了我们.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting a body of Macedonian infantry): via Latin from Greek

entry.def: A phalanx is a group of soldiers or police who are standing or marching close together ready to fight.
A phalanx of people is a large group who are brought together for a particular purpose.

means.word_mean: 1. any of the bones (or phalanges) of the fingers or toes
2. any closely ranked crowd of people
3. a body of troops in close array

auth_sentence.content: Oliver regularly required improbable technique to escape the attentions of a phalanx of defenders.
